com.shc.ahttp.client.request

Class ABasicAuthHttpRequestBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shc.ahttp.client.request.ABasicAuthHttpRequestBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AHttpGetRequest, AHttpPostRequest

    public abstract class ABasicAuthHttpRequestBase
extends Object
    The Apache Basic Authentication supporting HTTP Request Base class serves as the base class for any HTTP requestMethods class and contains different methods which utilizes the Apache HTTP client APIs to perform all common tasks related to preparing, sending, HTTP requests as well as receiving and reading HTTP response.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    vishalk2

        Uses the HttpClientBuilder to get the default HttpClient object
        Returns:
        the default HttpClient * @see HttpClientBuilder

      • executeHttpRequest

        protected AHttpClientResponse executeHttpRequest(org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpRequestBase httpRequest,
                                     String encoding,
                                     boolean includeResponseHeaders)
                                          throws AHttpClientCallException
        Execute the HTTP request by calling the HttpClient execute method
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - the http request HttpRequestBase
        encoding - the encoding of the request and the expected encoding of response for ex UTF-8
        includeResponseHeaders - whether to include headers captured from response, which might add a few more milliseconds to the response processing
        Returns:
        the extracted HTTP client response AHttpClientResponse * @throws AHttpClientCallException If any exception occurs during the request execution, it is enclosed in an instance of AHttpClientCallException
        Throws:
        AHttpClientCallException

      • processHttpResponse

        protected AHttpClientResponse processHttpResponse(org.apache.http.HttpResponse httpResponse,
                                      String encoding,
                                      boolean includeResponseHeaders)
                                           throws AHttpClientCallException
        Process the HTTP Response received. The method will check if the response is between 100 - 399 and it'll try to find if there is content in the body received. If the response code doesn't fall in ths range then it'll extract various response parameters such as returned status code, status phrase, response body if any, add them to a new AHttpClientCallException and throw it.
        Parameters:
        httpResponse - HttpResponse the HTTP response object received from the client call
        encoding - the encoding of the request and the expected encoding of response for ex UTF-8
        includeResponseHeaders - whether to include headers captured from response, which might add a few more milliseconds to the response processing
        Returns:
        the extracted HTTP client response AHttpClientResponse * @throws AHttpClientCallException if any exception or error status code is received then AHttpClientCallException is thrown
        Throws:
        AHttpClientCallException

      • getStringFromEntity

        protected String getStringFromEntity(org.apache.http.HttpEntity httpEntity,
                         String encoding)
                              throws AHttpClientCallException
        Gets HttpEntity content as String EntityUtils.toString(HttpEntity, String)
        Parameters:

        encoding - the encoding of the request and the expected encoding of response for ex UTF-8
        Returns:
        the String from entity content * @throws AHttpClientCallException If any exception occurred during the process, then encapsulate it in a AHttpClientCallException and throw it.
        Throws:
        AHttpClientCallException

      • getHttpEntityFromRequest

        protected org.apache.http.HttpEntity getHttpEntityFromRequest(String request,
                                                  String contentType)
        Gets the HttpEntity from a given request String. It uses the EntityBuilder
        Parameters:
        request - the request String.
        contentType - The content type of the request to be sent ex. Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
        Returns:
        the HttpEntity from request String.

      • addRequestHeaders

        protected void addRequestHeaders(Map<String,String> headersMap,
                     org.apache.http.HttpRequest httpRequest)
        Adds the request headers to a given HttpRequest. Note: The method adds the default content type of AHttpClientConstants.DEFAULT_CONTENT_TYPE to the list of headers if there is no HttpHeaders.CONTENT_TYPE set
        Parameters:
        headersMap - the headers map Map to be added
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest to which the headers need to be added

      • addRequestTimeoutConfig

        protected void addRequestTimeoutConfig(int connectTimeout,
                           org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpRequestBase httpRequest)
        Adds the request timeout to the given HttpRequestBase object by creating a custom instance of RequestConfig and setting the RequestConfig.Builder.setConnectionRequestTimeout(int), RequestConfig.Builder.setConnectionRequestTimeout(int), RequestConfig.Builder.setConnectionRequestTimeout(int)
        Parameters:
        connectTimeout - the connect timeout to be set in milliseconds
        httpRequest - the HttpRequestBase to which the timeout has to be set

      • addBasicAuthHttpHeader

        protected org.apache.http.protocol.HttpContext addBasicAuthHttpHeader(org.apache.http.HttpRequest httpRequest,
                                                          String username,
                                                          String password)
        Adds the BasicAuth Header to the given HttpRequest
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest to which the auth header needs to be added
        username - the basic auth username
        password - the password the basic auth password
        Returns:
        HttpContext using which the basic scheme generated the auth headers

      • getBasicAuthHttpHeader

        protected org.apache.http.Header getBasicAuthHttpHeader(org.apache.http.protocol.HttpContext httpContext,
                                            org.apache.http.HttpRequest httpRequest,
                                            String username,
                                            String password)
        Adds the BasicAuth Header to the given HttpRequest, by using BasicScheme.authenticate(org.apache.http.auth.Credentials, HttpRequest, HttpContext) to generate the authorization header
        Parameters:
        httpContext - HttpContext using which the basic scheme generated the auth headers
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest to which the auth header needs to be added
        username - the basic auth username
        password - the password the basic auth password
        Returns:
        the Header which contains the basic authorization string.
